item.title: U.S. Gun Laws
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Considering the dailyrecord article provided no sources, I’m going to go ahead and assume it’s extraordinarily biased
Found this statistic about the company that owns dailyrecord, also:
Net Income: US$ 588.2 million (2010)

During one of the worst points in the recession, the company managed to make $588M. It’s very likely that the company is mainly conservative/republican, which only reinforces the idea that the article is probably biased.

Actually, just found this after writing all of this:
http://www.fbi.gov/about-us/cjis/ucr/crime-in-the-u.s/2011/crime-in-the-u.s.-2011/tables/expanded-homicide-data-table-8

FBI article, completely disproves the dailyreport one. According to the FBI (very reliable, mind you), firearms are the murder weapons in over 67.7% of murders. Your argument is entirely invalid. If banning firearms could even reduce that number marginally, it should be done.

Edit:
Also notable, the murder volumes have gone down noticeably since the recession has started to vanish. As stated multiple times in the topic, and shown by this data, battling poverty would be the best way to combat murder and other crimes.

Another edit:
A second data set to back up the idea of the poverty causing murder rates to increase.
http://www.census.gov/compendia/statab/2012/tables/12s0310.pdf

Yet another edit:
The dailyreport article says this:

Fact Number One: According to FBI crime statistics, more people are murdered each year by a hammer or a club than those killed with a rifle or shotgun (2011, 496 murders by hammer/club versus 323 murders by rifle/shotgun). Fifty-three percent more murders are committed by hammers and clubs.
Which is entirely true. However, the biased article seems to have left an important statistic out of the equation. Handguns have commit more than 60% of the murders every single year, which falls under the category of firearms. This makes the title of the article ("Other weapons more lethal than guns") entirely false.

tl;dr Unreliable source, proven wrong in many ways
